intro: Tetranthera langifolia, commonly known as the long-leaved tetranthera, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenia plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and elongated, lance-shaped leaves. Its small, white or yellowish flowers are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. Tetranthera langifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
